page.title: 02LANDSCAPE/TOURISM-LOE POOL
page.content: The Pool is one and a quarter miles long, four and a half miles around, 800 to 900 feet wide.The river Cober supplies over four_fifths of its water.There are many trout in the pool which is very deep and weedy, making it dangerous for bathing.The pool has become smaller over the years because of silt carried down by the river Cober from old mine workings inland. The water level can rise causing floods in the St Johns area of Helston. The sign that flooding was getting serious was when the Town mill wheel stopped turning.In 1850 a natural adit was found that could drain water into the sea but sometimes it gets blocked by silt. The only thing to do to relieve the flooding is to breach Loe Bar to let the pool water drain to a safe level.
